Name: BS Button Game: Expansion Pack
Description:
BS Button Game Expansion Pack offers a new spin on shedding games like Doubt, Cheat, and Bullshit.  It includes a sound button, True Blue, which flashes bright blue and calls bullshit 70 different ways, 52 standard playing cards with original art, and a new wild card, the activist.

The addition of the activist card allows stand alone play with three to six players.  BS Button Game Expansion Pack can also be combined with BS Button Game to accommodate up to twelve players.

The activist is wild and can be played to call a rank out of sequence and force an opponent to discard that card or to bluff.  Players have the option of hitting the BS Button anytime they suspect a bluff.

The first player who discards every card while avoiding a valid call of bullshit wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Schatzsuche in der Buchstaben-Burg
Description: Using the Tip-Toi system, hunt for missing animal tiles by playing a variety of minigames put forward by the dragon.

Name: Iron Helm: Adventure Pack #1 – Warren of Despair
Description:
A set of 18 cards to move up to level 2

Warren of Despair is the 1st Adventure Pack for Iron Helm that adds all new Loot, Skills, Trappings, Plots, a new Boss to fight, and a new Character to play as. You will need to own the base game of Iron Helm to play this expansion.

Warren of Despair is a level two Adventure Pack meaning it is to be incorporated with the base game as your second adventure if you survive the base game.

Contents

1 Boss Card - 1 Character Card - 1 Skill Card - 2 Trappings Cards - 4 Loot Cards - 3 Plot Cards - 5 Enemy Cards - 1 Map Card

Name: Iron Helm: Adventure Pack #2 – Blackened Burrow
Description:
Blackened Burrow is the 2nd Adventure Pack for Iron Helm that adds all new Loot, Skills, Trappings, Plots, a new Boss to fight, and a new Character to play as. You will need to own the base game of Iron Helm to play this expansion.

Blackened Burrow is a level three Adventure Pack meaning it is to be incorporated with the base game as your third adventure if you survive the base game and a level 2 Adventure Pack.

1 Boss Card - 1 Character Card - 1 Skill Card - 2 Trappings Cards - 4 Loot Cards - 3 Plot Cards - 5 Enemy Cards - 1 Map Card

--description from designer

Name: Euclio Tricky!
Description:
The second expansion to Euclio, Euclio Tricky! adds five new scoring boards and accompanying suit cards to make your games even more varied and interesting.

These new boards are a bit more... tricky, and therefore recommended for Euclio veterans, but all retain the general simplicity of play Euclio has always had.

Euclio Tricky! adds a risky new chip type, more calls to have points on hand, and a surprise behind door number 2! Get ready to sweat bullets staring down these tricky new suits. Simply add to your Euclio box and experience a new mixture of gameplay possibilities!

—description from the designer

Name: Raging Kingdoms
Description:
Raging Kingdoms is a real-time strategy inspired medieval board game.

Command one of history’s great empires and lead it to victory through skillful economic development, technological advancement, and, of course, the art of WAR!

Raging Kingdoms is a game for two to six players. A typical game takes 90 to 120 minutes.

Win by conquering all enemy empires, or by leaving them in awe of your Wonder Victory. Each turn, you'll roll a special die for your action moves. Make the most of your action moves to march closer to your goal.


     Create new units - villagers to gather resources, scouts to discover the hidden map, or swordsmen, archers and knights to crush threatening neighbors.
     Construct new buildings - camps to exploit resources, blacksmiths to equip your army, and towers to defend against aggressive opponents.
     Research new technologies to help your empire reach new heights.
     Devise the perfect attack to conquer new land and show your enemies your rage!


At the end of your turn, collect the resources your villagers have gathered for you and start planning your next moves!

Raging Kingdoms delivers in a tabletop game all the best parts of classic RTS video games, like:

     A randomly generated map that players discover, making each game different
     Managing the gathering and stockpiling of 4 resources
     Finding the perfect balance between reinvesting in your economy, strengthening your military, and researching new technology
     Choosing which military units will be most effective in which battle situations
     Strategically deciding when, where, and how to strike your opponents
     Tactically commanding units to lead them to victory


—description from the publisher

Name: Tetrad
Description:
This book brings together several related exercises in game design. The game of Tetrad itself is the product of an effort to devise a simple game of abstract strategy for four players . . . .

The Tetrad board was designed with several considerations in mind: to provide a layout well suited to a four-way game, to accommodate a wide variety of traditional games, and to be compact enough to fit on the cover of the book. . . .

The TETRAD playing field consists of 120 octagonal spaces arranged in an octagonal pattern. This pattern is printed on both covers. The game is played on one side of the closed book. The playing pieces and dice are stored inside of the book.

The game of TETRAD is designed to be played by exactly four people.

—description from the book

Each player begins the game with six pieces of the same color. These are arranged in a row along one side of the board.

At the center of the board is a group of four spaces. These are each marked with a symbol. The objective of the game is to group four of one's playing pieces at the center. The first player whose color occupies all four of these spaces at the same time, wins the game.

The players take turns casting the dice and moving their pieces. A player begins a turn by casting the two dice. The score of the dice is the total number of steps that the player's pieces may be moved in that turn. One step is the movement of one piece from one space into the next. The pieces can be moved vertically or horizontally, but not diagonally. Moving your piece onto a space that is already occupied replaces your opponents color with your own.

The TETRAD board can be used to play many other games; instructions for various and adapted games are included in the book.

—user summary

Name: Dimes
Description:
Dimes is a party game that tests your ability to read the minds of your friends.

Using a Dimes card you'll present a friend with an either/or question. All the remaining players will try to guess which item that player prefers. Players are rewarded for successfully reading other players' minds.

The game is easily adapted as a drinking game and is ideal for party/social settings

—description from the publisher

Name: NUBIAH: Das Geheimnis
Description:
This game was manufactured out of three different types of wood: Walnut, Pear and Acorn which have different colours thus making distinctive tokens. The name NUBIAH results out of the woods german names 'NUss BIrne AHorn'.

The playing board is a grid of 5x5 stones. Every second stone is fixed leaving a movable row of neutral tokens between them. This results in 4 moveable rows on the board.

Each player gets a total of 9 tokens of which 3 are unnumbered and the rest has a number between 1 and 6. The players start shoving their tokens in the gaming board and try to push out the opponent's already placed stones. The clue about this is, that you only can insert a stone in a row if your total score supersedes your opponent's.

If you manage to put all your tokens in the board you win.

—user summary

Name: The D.I.N.K. Game
Description:
Goodbye Trivia, hello D.I.N.K. game. The game of the 1990's is here! Introducing new and exciting concepts. Guaranteed to known your socks off! You're given the opportunity to become a real life D.I.N.K. created by strategic moves, lucky dice rolling, and plain ol' good fun. It's exciting and fast paced.
—description from the publisher

Look out Yuppies, the D.I.N.K.S. have arrived! The Baby Boomers second generation is here! Once family-bound, now striving for Double Income No Kids. The combination of two incomes allows D.I.N.K.s to live the upper class lifestyle. . . .

The object of the D.I.N.K. Game is to live and acquire materialistic objects like a real live D.I.N.K. The Double Income will allow this between you and your spouse, by playing in teams and working together. Therefore the winner of the game is the first team to acquire the complete the D.I.N.K. Checklist, accumulating at least 40 points and acquiring $250,000 in the bank.
—description from the rulebook

May also be played in the S.I.N.K. version (SINGLE INCOME NO KIDS). Same rules apply but there is only a single income.
—from a note on the inside of the box

D.I.N.K. = Double Income No Kids

Name: Buzzwords
Description:
Are you thinking what I'm thinking? You'll never know unless you play BUZZWORDS!

A challenging word game of first thoughts and second guesses. See how well you can zero in on a given category and determine its most obvious BUZZWORDS. Then find out how well you and your friends can think alike by guessing each others BUZZWORDS.

—description from the box

Name: Sevenel
Description:
… SEVENEL is the future! SEVENEL has all those multiple choice questions everyone prefers. SEVENEL has no dice and we offer each player the opportunity to "Jump-In" on other people's questions. In addition, SEVENEL has more strategy than we can possibly explain. Using 7 different playing surfaces we have eliminated that dizzy feeling as well as "board boredom". Finally, if you do fall asleep, your opponents will be thrilled because they will surely benefit!

These are a few of the advantages the future holds for you with SEVENEL. We want you to experience the challenges we have discovered while playing the most versatile game of our time. And, there is no right or wrong way to play SEVENEL - you create your own version each time you play.

As you see, the history of trivia games promises to be much better as . . .

"night after night
        we play into the future!"

—description from the publisher

Name: Wordmaster
Description:
Increase vocabulary and word skills with WORDMASTER, a board game for players from early school age through adult.

Players earn points by correctly spelling, defining, identifying the part of speech and using the word on each card. Six degrees of challenge and achievement are built into color-coded cards. For individual or team play. (Play may be limited by time or number of turns.)

The Home Version of WORDMASTER is designed to allow participation by all family members, with three separate words on each card. These three groupings are for: children under 12, teens and adults.

School versions of WORDMASTER are designed for use in all grade levels.

Additional Word Card sets are available for different occupational specialities and special interests. The unique magnetic game board and magnetic playing pieces facilitate play and may be utilized with any Word Card set.

WORDMASTER has been developed from appropriate curriculum sources to provide a game that is both fun and exciting to play, as well as educationally rewarding.

Name: L'Ombre de l'Aigle: The Shadow of the Eagle – Volume 4: The Franco-Prussian War
Description:
Strategic game on the 1870 war, using the same game system that the Flight of the Eagle series.

Focused on the first phase of the war. Also includes a "fast system" that can be used in face to face or via an umpire.

Units for all divisions are provided as counters for the strategic part, and as units per corps for the umpire-mediated game.

—description from the designer

Name: Adidoku Niños: Frankenstein y Amigos
Description:
In this Adidoku, designed for CHILDREN 8 years and older, they will guess connections of words and concepts, developing language, concentration and organization skills. More than 500 halves of concepts and phrases to assemble the image of a large mosaic with Frankenstein, Medusa, Dracula, Skull, Witch and Fairy.

Inside the box, you will also find a completely different game, called Crucibujos (from the creators of Adigma).

"Crucibujos" 
Can you be the first to form a line of 5 images of your color with your pieces, connected by one of the Crucibujos strokes But be careful, players can capture your pieces!
Detect which images will give you more advantage and build your strategy.

Name: Czółko: Bez Cenzury
Description:
CzóÅ‚ko: Bez Cenzury is a simple Polish party game use silly moves, accents and weird performances to convey the word or phrase on the card that’s on your friends head to help him or her guess it!

Use multiple exciting game variant like Bomb or Platypus to limit ways one can show the card contents!

The Uncensored Crew quickly sets off any adult party. Gather friends, partners or acquaintances and using the forehead as a game board, show your teammates a password from the 18+ category! The dungeon will provide you with an authentic explosion of laughter thanks to the bomb rule - forbidden passwords, and various ways of presenting passwords will add to the pictorial fun of the whole fun. Simple rules, slogan and instant gameplay for a recipe for an unforgettable event from CzóÅ‚ko: Bez Cenzury!

Name: Desolate: BFG Promo Card
Description:
Promo card for the Desolate game. Comes in the Iron Helm game by same designer (Jason Glover) and publisher (The Game Crafter). It is also available in a promo pack called the Gnome Pack #1, from Grey Gnome Games on the Game Crafter.

The card is an ITEMS card and reads:

Discard 1 Power Cell to activate the BFG.
Once activated, whenever you roll a 5 or a 6 in combat it auto-kills the alien.

Name: Luftwaffe: RAF Bomber Command Expansion
Description:
Adding the RAF Bomber Command campaign to Luftwaffe.

Rules and unmounted counters inside the magazine.

Mounted counters are separately available.

Name: Cannibal Collective
Description:
Cannibal Collective is a party game for people who have a strong stomach.

The premise of the game is simple, you have been invited to the 58th Annual Cannibal Collective initiation dinner and as part of the initiation you have to collect the very best bodyparts to comprise your meal.

The first person to collect 1 of each of the 7 body part cards is the winner.

But be warned! There are many other aspects at play! These include The Platypus of Doom, Mystic Lamp Wizards, Assassins, Cloaks of Invisibility, Martians, Zombies, Ninjas, Vampires, Psychics, Leprosy, Magicians, Chainsaws and more.

You collect the body parts by using attack cards and wildcards to steal them from other players, as well as picking them up from the deck. You lose body parts when other players attack you, though you can use defence cards and wildcards to stop other player's attacks.

Wildcards include the Magician card, where a player leaves the room and a card is hidden. They then have to find it and if they can't they lose 3 body parts.

The game takes roughly 20 minutes to play but gets quicker as it progresses as the number of body parts in the deck dwindles.

Each player can play as many cards as they want during their turn and ends their go when they pick up a card.

—description from the designer

Name: Match-o-Rama
Description:
In this press-your-luck party game, test how well you can predict what others will say at the table! Get points for matching answers that fall within a specific range of people-whoever gets the highest score wins.

—description from the publisher

Name: Treasure X: Quest for Gold
Description:
Explore Xeo and discover buried riches. Collect money, keys and the coveted golden treasures! If Exis attacks, you could lose everything!


     Play Cards to explore map
     Reveal the buried surprise
     Don't let Exis steal your treasures


—description from the publisher

Name: Carbomorphozis
Description:
What can you see at first?

There are two coal armies lined up against each other. In the terrain where they move, every square obligates the characters to transform. When a character moves to a square of transformation, it has to change, but not only it’s appearance  will be different, but it’s ability to move and attack will be also changed.

3 characters, 2 teams, 1 battle

If I want to look for a similar game to Carbomorphozis, the first game that comes to my mind is the great, classic chess. Checkered board with 64 squares, 8 puppets, step and punch actions. However, while chess pieces are diverse with many features, we only have to count on 3 characters. And as long as everything is given in chess and victory depends solely on tactics, in Carbomorphozis the characters change from one step to another and this influences the outcome of the party and the applied military plan.

This board game is educational as well, because it combines three types of carbon in our minds for a lifetime. Thanks to the variety of the board, there are 256 different playing fields.

You can start the game on any side, giving you 1024 different play options, so the chance of repeating play is 1 to 1000, it means you won't get bored during the replays.

The playing time is relatively short, 20-30 minutes, so it is suitable for you if you have just little freetime. It doesn't need too much preparation, just take it out from the box and the game can begin. Another advantage is that it does not take place on too much space, so you can play it even while traveling by train.

I walk, I walk ... but what will happen to me when I stop?

The main driver of the game is transformation. Since it is a transformation of coal, the name of the game is the result of the fusion of the Latin name of carbon (carbon) and the Latin word for transformation (metamorphosis).

The pictograms on the game board symbolize a transformation. The given square determines what character should step on it in order that the carbomorphosis  can occur. It also specifies the new material structure.

Coal here or there… or is it already graphite?

There are three actions that you can take in the game: move, punch and transform. The first one and the second one are the player's decision, and the third one is the result of that decision. It is determined by the player’s move with the selected character or the square where the character is moved after the punch.

The purpose of the game is to beat all of your opponent's characters on the playing field. The more valuable our puppets are, the easier the task is for us and the harder for the opponent.

The game is as loose as the connection between the layers of graphite

What do we obtain with this game? The game primarily focuses on concentration and foresight, and therefore develops tactical skill. Because the rule is simple and easy to understand, the character's stepping and punching features are depicted on the characters themselves, and the transformations on the game board, so there is no need to learn the rules separately. The game can be started instantaneously and does not require lengthy learning.

As the game progresses, circumstances change so this board game is suitable for the more impatient children, too ; because it inspires them to make flexible decisions and modify easily  the previously planned steps.

If the players are children, the game can match to their forward thinking, which is only 1-2 steps. But nevertheless, it may require 4-5 step forward thinking from adult players, so the same game can be fun for all ages.

—description from the designer

Name: Jan-Ken-Po
Description:
Jan-Ken-Po (a Hawaiian name for Rock-Scissors-Paper) is a collectible card game with eighty cards in total, of which each box contains a random and poorly collated fifty. It is possible to get five of the same weapon in one set.  
 The game is set on Krone II (according to the box) or Pangea (according to the rulebook), where a centuries-old war has created three clans: the Paper Clan (yellow), the Scissors Clan (magenta) and the Stone Clan (blue). Most cards show badly drawn members of each clan and their weapons.

Players simultaneously reveal the top card on their deck, and stone cards beats scissors cards, scissors beat paper, and paper beats stone. With the exception of resolving ties and a 3-player version, that's the rules. Except there are rare monsters that beat all the clan cards, the wizard Jan-Ken-Po who beats everything, and a 'You Lose!' card ('the Herb of Destruction'), which must be played on yourself and makes you lose.

An attempt to cash in on the CCG boom of the mid 1990s, the game is noted for its low production values, amateurish art that is often printed sideways on the cards, a backstory that makes no sense, and gameplay that  takes Rock-Scissors-Paper and removes all the skill and tactics.

—user summary

Name: Songs From the Axe and Fiddle
Description:
Songs from the Axe and Fiddle presents a collection of brand-new ways for you to explore the world of Fall of Magic.

Each “Song” includes a new introduction, names, titles, setup, and prompts that focus on a particular character, or part of the world. Use them as a introduction to a longer Fall of Magic game, play them in sequence, or play them between sessions of your regular game of Fall of Magic.

The four Songs included in this collection are:

Song of the Fugitive
Song of the Swineherd
Song of the Deep
Song of the Stormwing

—description from the publisher

Name: ドキドキ！自己紹介ゲーム (Doki Doki! Jiko Shokai Game)
Moonstone: Gotchgut the Giant Monster Box
Description:
This monster box includes one new miniature of giant mercenary. He can be hired either as Dominion or Commonwealth fraction.
This miniature is made in fine quality resin. Miniature requires assembly.
Gotchgut is a giant - very strong, but not so fast being.

—description from the publisher

Name: Slavisti
Description:
Slavisti is an abstract strategy game that comes with matches. It seems very simple at first glance, but is a game with strategic depth. It is designed as a non-commercial game.

Each player has two play areas on the table. In one area, only Roman numbers of 1s (I) 5s (V) and 10s (X) are formed with sticks. In the other area forms are laid. With the exception of the first stick, in the second area, sticks may only be laid at one end of a laying stick. So that both created an angle of 60, 90 or 180 degrees. It usually creates squares and equilateral triangles.
A special feature of the game is that a player can also lay sticks in the opposing areas. If you have laid down a stick in the enemy area, which has an open side, you may only lay there again, if you can lay a stick there, which is then closed at both ends. If that does not work, you can only lay down sticks in your own area.
When all the sticks have been laid, you can only lay sticks; never taking away the last laid wood. In the end, no stick may have an open end. 
The goal is to match the number of shapes (rectangles, parallelograms, trapezoids, and triangles) with the number of the Roman numeral.

—description from the publisher

Name: ワードスナイパー (Word Sniper)
Lost Kitties Game
Description:
In this Lost Kitties board game, the kitties are lost in the factory and players have to help them find their friends. Kids move their Lost Kitties character pawn around the board, drawing cards, and flipping over mystery kitty tokens as they search for their squad members. The game includes a meme sticker and an accessory hidden inside the shaping compound.

—description from the publisher

Name: Deception/CS-Files: Role Card Pack – Hong Kong film edition
Description:
12 Role Cards with new artwork design for a Hong Kong Murder Film.

(Only 60 packs worldwide)
Families: Game: Deception – Murder in Hong Kong

Name: ワードスナイパーエクストリーム (Word Sniper Extreme)
Description: ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚¹ãƒŠã‚¤ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ã‚¨ã‚¯ã‚¹ãƒˆãƒªãƒ¼ãƒ  (Word Sniper Extreme) is a small expansion deck that works with the base game ãƒ¯ãƒ¼ãƒ‰ã‚¹ãƒŠã‚¤ãƒ‘ãƒ¼ (Word Sniper). The cards work the same as the original game, with themes on one side and letters on the reverse. But the theme is tucked onto a base card (like a pillow on a bed), and so adds a more complex context to the theme. Likewise, the letter side of the cards show several characters, forcing more challenging solutions.

Name: Legends of Wrestling: Expansion Pack 2
Description:
The second Legends color expansion pack, with a focus on southeastern US wrestlers. This game edition includes 10 new game cards and a printed handbook featuring bios for all wrestlers.

Wrestlers included are: Barry Windham, Brad Armstrong, Magnum T.A., Tully Blanchard, Blackjack Mulligan, Ivan Koloff, Sam Houston,  Johnny Valentine, Jimmy Valiant and the Masked Superstar

—description from the publisher

Name: Memento Mori
Description: This deck has 72 NEW and intriguing questions to ignite conversation and curiosity about death. Memento Mori can be played as a standalone conversation starter or as an expansion deck for the original deck.

Name: Legends of Wrestling: Expansion Pack 3
Description:
The legendary Stan Hansen makes his LOW debut in Legends Expansion III!  Hansen is an international superstar with ties to many of the current LOW roster.  Will he reform his devastating tag team with Brusier Brody?  Will he target former rival Nick Bockwinkel?  Your promotion is about to be turned upside down! The set includes the following wrestlers.

Steve “Mr. Electricity” Regal, Nick Bockwinkel, Ray Stevens Stan Hansen,  Mad Dog Vachon, Red Bastein, Larry Zybysko, Butcher Vachon, The Crusher and Billy Red Lyons.

—description from the publisher

Name: Great War at Sea Jutland: Battle Analysis
Description:
More ink has been spilled over the Battle of Jutland than any other naval battle in history. Jutland: Battle Analysis 1914 looks at what happened before the Battle of Jutland: Helgoland Bight, the Scarborough Raid, the Yarmouth Raid and more.
Jutland: Battle Analysis 1914' is different from other works on the North Sea campaign, thanks to its ties to our Great War at Sea: Jutland game. We look at how the game simulates the operations, and then we flesh them out with more battle scenarios – fast-playing actions using just the Tactical Map, where you fight out the battles between ships with guns and torpedoes.
Jutland, the game, has a lot of scenarios: 51 in total. Forty-four of those are operational scenarios, but only seven of them are battle scenarios. So the Battle Analysis adds 26 more of them, based on the surface actions that could have taken place – or at least one side hoped would take place – based on the expectations of one or both naval staffs when they sent the fleets to sea. Plus nine new operational scenarios.
Jutland is already a very fine game (our most popular ever, even more than Third Reich) and a good instrument through which to re-play history. The Battle Analysis makes it even more so, while adding more quick fun by fleshing out the battle scenario aspect of the game.
Jutland: Battle Analysis 1914 is a 64-page, large-format book supplement for Jutland; you’ll need a copy of the game to play most of the scenarios and Cruiser Warfare to play all of them.

—description from the publisher
Families: Series: Great War at Sea (Avalanche Press)

Name: Bossbattle Bunnies
Description:
Bossbattle Bunnies is a short, fun card game for 3-6 players. In this game you embark on a 10-20 minute bunny-themed dungeon crawl with your friends. You'll find loot, get cursed, fight monsters, and most importantly, test your friendships. It's easy to learn the game as you go along, so grab a beer (or a lemonade) and go adventuring!

As if a pocket-size dungeon crawl wasn't awesome enough already, this game doubles as regular playing cards. That means you can use it for Poker, Solitaire, Go fish and all the other classics. Talk about value-for-money! You can even take it to the bar, do some tricks and sweep someone off their feet. Just be sure to send me an invite to the wedding if you do!

Bossbattle Bunnies originally had my own artstyle for consistency, but then I figured it would be way cooler to have many different artists (18 in total) contribute to this project in their own style. This resulted in 54 unique illustrations that together turn this 2-in-1 deck of cards into a portable museum!

—description from the designer

Name: H.O.T.: Headlines on Tabloids
Description:
At last you can make the news! Bluff your way to the top and win fame and fortune by creating your own sensational mind-boggling Headlines. Play H.O.T., the wildly entertaining game that contains all the thrills of a roller coaster ride. H.O.T. is a hilarious, nail-biting adventure that gives you the chance to scoop incredible and outrageous Headlines of your own.

If you convince the other players that your phony headlines are authentic, then you can fib first to the finish to become a billionaire Tabloid Tycoon. Expose the lurid lifestyles of the rich and famous! Uncover sexy scandalous secrets! Investigate mysteries that defy the logic of science! Play H.O.T., the HEADLINES ON TABLOIDS game and experience an excitement you will never forget!!!

—description from the publisher

Name: Zoundz•Like
Description:
Bend Your Mind With Words in Disguise

Are you the kind of individual who enjoys solving personalized messages on car license plates? If so, Zoundz•Like will be an exciting and challenging game for you.

Players must solve the word of phrase disguised in the playword in less than 30 seconds.(Zoundz•Like is a lot more fun and easier to solve if you voice the playword out loud.) The first player or team to land exactly on the start/win space wins the game.

A die roll determines the play card number to be solved and the number of board game moves allowed. When a star appears behind a playword, the player must also give the correct spelling. Drive-By is a bonus turn with a 5 second time limit. Twisters are playwords which require mental and/or visual gymnastics to solve the word puzzle.

—description from the rulebook (summarized)

Name: Alice
Description:
The Ludik Quebec Alice Board Game is a game of observation and speed for children 6 years and older. This game is designed with beautiful illustrations of the characters from the tale of Alice in Wonderland. The first player who finds the identical characters and exhausts all the cards in his deck as soon as possible wins the game! A simple and fun game that will appeal to your youngest!

Getting Ready: 

     A player shuffles the cards ad separates them into two equal piles
     Players sit in front of each other, take their pile of cards and put it face down in front of them
     Using the discs they make two columns of four discs each face up, leaving a space between columns large enough to contain four cards side by side.


Playing the game:
The game goes on until one of the players plays out his entire pile of cards.
Each turn is comprised of four steps, each one starting the same way
Players count to three, take the top card of their own pile and put it simultaneously in front of their opponents turned card. 
As soon as their cards are turned, players must be quick to locate identical cards. If there are no identical cards on the playing area, players move to the next step.

When there are two identical cards on the playing area, the first player to hit the disc matching the character on them taes a card from his own pile and covers one of the identical cards.
Players move on to the next step only when there are no identical cards on the playing area.

Note: Identical cards may be found in any column, not necessarily facing each other. In that case, players proceed in the same way. The player who is the quickest to hit the right disc covers one of the identical cards using a card from his own pile.

The first player to play the last card on his pile wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Screwed
Description:
Screwed . . . the card game where you're in it for yourself!

There are no partners!!!

The object of the game is to obtain the highest score by accurately predicting how many tricks you will take each round. The more you frustrate your opponents by taking their tricks or making them take tricks they do not want, the better your chances of winning will be.

Each round the strategy changes and you can try to bribe, beg, or sweet talk your opponents into helping you make your bid. If you fail, you can get revenge in the next round. Revenge is sweet! Players will find themselves with impetuous feelings of laughter, joy, hat, annoyance, excitement, or antagonism.

The trick to winning this challenging game is a mixture of skill and a lot of luck. No matter what your skill level, everyone has a chance to win this stimulating game.

Good luck . . . you'll need it!

—description from the back of the box

Contains six plastic screws with nuts used for bidding.

Name: Influencer
Description:
In Influencer, players take on the roles of wannabe influencers, chasing moments in real life not for the experience but instead for the social power of posting them later. Not every moment will prove to be popular though, as players watch the trending topics change round after round. Whoever can build their timeline in a way that attracts the most followers by the end of the game is the winner – though regardless of the outcome, the players may find out they’re all still wannabe influencers in the end!

Gameplay of Influencer is incredibly simple. Players collect cards resembling social media posts which have an image, a description, and different thematic categories (such as Gaming, Sports, Fashion, Health, Travel, etc.). Players draft cards from an open area each round with the final, unselected card becoming the trending topic (thematically this is to say that no matter what the players end up posting there is always something cooler than all of them… they are wannabe influencers after all!). After drafting players add a card from their hand to their feed (a row of cards in front of them). They then score based on chaining categories together (such as 3 Food posts in a row) and also earn points for matching the trending topic. As rounds proceed players remove cards from the end of their feed, placing them in their discard, making only their most relevant posts matter.

A casual, filler game, learned in minutes, Influencer is a lightweight experience that allows its designer, Peter Jürgensen, to play with humor and satire regarding a topic that many people can relate to.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fighting Chance
Description:
In Fighting Chance choose one of four heroes to try and save the city. But everyone wants to be the best hero in the city, not only do you battle a collection of increasingly powerful rouges, you are trying to be a better hero than the heroes beside you.

Fighting Chance is a cooperative game of every person for themselves.

Fighting Chance is a game of three battle rounds to see who can become the strongest hero and save they City between two phases: training and battle.

Training Round 
Players can play two training cards from the training pile.  Follow any instructions on the training card. Put the used training cards in the training discard pile.  Players must discard their remaining training card.  At the beginning of the next training round players may draw three training cards again, but still play only two.  If there are not enough cards in the training card draw pile, shuffle the training card discard pile.  There is a training card called Diversify Your Portfolio, this card allows players to gain two of any attribute, but it may also be split between to attributes.

Battle Round 
Once the heroes are trained let the battle begin. 
Flip over the rouge for round 1.  Place the energy marker on the rogue board.
In additional rounds flip over round two’s rogue at the beginning of the battle round for round two, and round three’s rogue at the beginning of battle round three.
Note any special abilities that this rogue may have.  If a rogue is immune to solo attacks of level X, a player may play a solo attack if their skill exceeds the immunity.  For example if a rogue is immune to solo attacks of three or greater of mysticism, but the player has a level four or greater of mysticism, they may still attack at this level.  
The most experienced player should go first.
For the first round each player gets dealt seven cards, but has a hand size of three.  They players draw three cards in their hand, and draw up to three at the beginning of each turn.  If the player discards all their Battle Cards during a round, they are out of the round, but live to fight another day. 
For round two each player gets dealt eight cards with a hand size of four.
For round three each player gets dealt ten cards with a hand size of five.
At the end of each round place all unused cards in the discard pile.  Shuffle the Battle Cards and deal them for the next round.

They player with the most points at the end of round three wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Heart of Crown: Fairy Garden – Advanced Play Mini Expansion
Description:
Are you a Heart of Crown expert? Get to the action faster by swapping out your starting deck in this mini expansion. Compatible with all the Heart of Crown games - the base game is required (original Heart of Crown or Fairy Garden).

In the Advanced Play Mini Expansion, each player starts the game with a deck of 10 cards as listed below. Otherwise, the rules of the game are unchanged.

6 Farming Villages
1 Mansion (New)
1 Attendant (New)
1 Alternate Art Apprentice Maid
1 Personal Maid (New)

To begin the game, instead of the number of Apprentice Maids, determine who goes first by who has the highest total number of Attendants, Apprentice Maids, and Personal Maids. All four Personal Maids have the same effect.

Number of Cards Included: 16
Sleeve Size: Standard

—description from the publisher

Name: Merchants Cove: The Innkeeper
Description:
As Mr. Nasty, the infamous innkeeper, you give customers a simple promise: a stiff drink, soft bed, and swift kick in the pants for those who start trouble. You won’t sell large goods at the piers like other merchants in town. Instead, you’ll offer room and board to tired adventurers after the markets close for the day. But space is limited and customers are fussy—the last thing you want is folks yapping about a bad experience…

The Innkeeper is a new merchant you can play as. It is centered around a speculation game, where you try to prepare rooms for the most common adventurers in play at the end of each round. If you plan well and satisfy your guests, you can yield an ever-increasing income. However, if you fail, you can expect brawls to break out—which can hurt your business!

—description from the publisher

Name: Merchants Cove: The Oracle
Description:
As Haggatha the Oracle, you deal in fortunes for the unfortunate. Read the stars, divine the future, and twist the fates in your attempts to part folks from their precious gold. Weary adventurers visit your shop in search of hope and guidance. You offer this through lucky charms and horoscopes, but sometimes you need to do a little voodoo, too. Just be careful not to let your dark dabblings—or dirty dishes—scare away too many honest customers!

The Oracle is a new merchant you can play as. It is centered around a roll & write style game, with a pen, dry-erase board, and custom dice tray. Each turn you throw a handful of runes (a coin, bone, voodoo meeple, and dice) into a divided dish, then you record the results on your board in various ways to perform actions—and predict the future!

—description from the publisher
Families: Components: Dry Erase Markers / Dry Erase Surfaces

Name: Gosu: Kao
Description: A promo card for Gosu

Name: RAMO
Description:
Ramo is a game that has the best parts from Contract Rummy, Mahjong and Uno combined, hence the name RAMO.

The object of the game is to have the least amount of points after playing the 8th level.

For each hand, each player's object is to complete and lay down his/her current level’s requirement, and then rid their hand of remaining cards by discarding them on laid-down levels, called "expanding". The player who does this first wins the hand and scores minus fifty; all other players earn penalty points according to the value of cards remaining in their hand.

In each round the players reduce the value of the cards held in their hands by laying on the table those cards that fit the requirement of his/her own level which consists of Sets and Runs.


     A Set consists of three or four cards, all different colored
     A Run consists of three or more cards in sequence, all same colored 
     The 13th card can be used in the middle when making Runs (eg: 12-13-1)


There are 60 cards in one deck, and two decks are used in a 3 or 5-player game, three decks for more players:

     52 numbered cards: each valued from 1 to 13, in four different colors. 
     two Wild cards
     one Skip card
     one -1 card
     two x2 cards
     one +3 card 
     one ? card


The Deal

The first player (dealer) shuffles the deck and before dealing, the next player “cuts” the deck, the dealer then deals 13 cards to the next player, and 12 cards to the rest of the players, the remaining cards are placed face down in the center of the table to form the Draw Deck, the player with the 13 cards in hand discards one card from his/her hand to start a Discard Pile, then the game continues counter-clockwise.

Gameplay

On each turn, a player:

     Draws either the face-up top card of the Discard Pile or one card from the deck.
     May lay down their completed round-appropriate collection of Sets and Runs.
     May play off other players who have laid down once they have laid down themselves.
     May discard one card from their hand onto the discard pile. When a player discards a card that could have been played off on their own or another player's laid cards is a "Ramo". Only players that are LAID DOWN may call out Ramo. The FIRST player to call Ramo must take the discarded one card to make a new Set or Run, or expand any laid down cards in the game even if it’s not his/her turn. The regular counter-clockwise order of turns may be interrupted for Ramo if the player who calls Ramo is not directly after the discarder (in order of play), one or two players will essentially miss their turn as play continues counter-clockwise from the player who calls Ramo. If multiple players call Ramo for a discarded card, priority for the discard goes to the player who calls out Ramo first. 


Play continues, in alternating turns, until one player goes out, or has no cards left in their hand. A player goes out when he successfully discards the only remaining card in hand, marking the conclusion of the step for all players.

It is customary to announce other players when there is only one card left in your hand. This alerts other players of closeness to going out. Points are tallied and recorded by a score-keeper. All of the cards are shuffled and the next round of play commences. Whoever has the most amount of scores (penalties), deals the next round (Level).

Level requirements:

     two sets
     one set and one run
     two runs
     three sets
     two sets and one run
     one set and two runs
     three runs
     four sets or four runs


Scoring:
Five points for each card remaining in hand with value 1-9
Ten points for each card remaining in hand with value 10-13
Twenty points for each Special Card remaining in hand

—description from the designer

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Tully Cavaliers
Description:
The alliance between House Tully and House Stark is one of the strongest in Westeros. The two have been taking to the field together for generations. In its darkest hour, House Stark knows it can rely on House Tully to be there, sending their best troops to engage the enemy. And those best troops are arguably the Tully Cavaliers, some of the most resilient and well-trained cavalry units in the land. House Stark players will soon be able to add this stalwart unit to their ranks. Let’s take a look at what these riders can do.

If there is one thing the House Tully Cavaliers are known for, it’s their devastating charges. While cavalry units of all types are known for strong charge attacks, the Tully Cavaliers’ make any other cavalry’s charge seem quaint by comparison. On the tabletop, this is represented by the Cavalier’s Lance attack. It rolls six dice whenat full ranks and gains several bonuses when charging, including: 3 extra dice, Critical Blow, and Sundering. So, they have more dice to attack with, gain extra Hits when they roll 6s, and the enemy’s Defense Save is reduced. Truly, they can devastate an enemy formation with an attack like that. The Cavalier’s best bet is to charge in and wipe out an enemy right away.

However, assuming that doesn’t happen, the Cavaliers aren’t entirely helpless. Their own Defense Save is a very sturdy 3+ and their Morale is a 5+. The unit will not easily be taking Wounds and will be passing most Morale Tests they make, even if they are given some sort of disadvantage.

The view of a unit of Tully Cavaliers baring down on their enemies is enough to raise the morale of surrounding troops. This is brought to the tabletop via the unit’s Embolden ability. It grants other friendly units within Short Range a +1 to their Morale test rolls. This means more of the Stark player’s rolls will be successful and fewer models will be removed when a test is made. As such, the Cavaliers are a great centerpiece, literally, to any army.

—description from the publisher
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Fast & Frog
Description:
Quick! Help your frogs cross the pond! Roll your dice to make them jump from one water lily to another. Be careful! If you pass an opponent’s frog, there is a battle. The loser returns to the start space. The first player to reach their frog-filled pond is declared the winner. This game develops motor skills and promotes the learning of numbers.

—description from the publisher

Name: Rome & Carthage: Bonus Cards
Description:
4 bonus cards bonus cards available at Spiel 2012 and distributed with Plato magazine #59 (September 2013).

These cards are useful with the 'Rapid Conquest' advanced rule, which is included in the rules booklet.

Name: Cars 3: Auta do Auta
Description:
The time when each journey is an adventure car does not last forever in children. Sometimes it doesn't even come. For these cases, it is useful to have a backup cars in the car.

Traveling game full of fun tasks will save you a long time wherever you are.

Difficulty of tasks is graded for children from 4, 6 and 8 years, just select the cards with the right symbols.

The main goal of the game is to entertain all participants. But victory can look forward to who earns the most points by completing tasks.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: 怪盗オーシャンズ (Kaitou Oceans)
Description:
æ€ªç›—ã‚ªãƒ¼ã‚·ãƒ£ãƒ³ã‚º (Kaitou Oceans) is a Japanese game of phantom thieves robbing a casino (as in Oceans 11). Players go through phases of examining the safe, declaring a robbery, then dividing up the spoils. And one player is secretly a detective, trying to spoil the thieves attempts.

The $Billions is stored in a safe, but only one of four locations actually has the money. Players start by examing the decks to find it (players can lie about what they find). When a player feels sure, they declare the job is on and players play bid cards face-down. If the total bid beats the target, the safe is cracked. Then the players bid again in an auction to divide up the loot (matching bids are cancelling). At the end of the game, the player with the most money wins.

If the detective can make the robberies fail, or recover the loot, the thieves fail.
user summary

Name: The Newlywed Game: DVD Edition
Description:
Play the classic couple's game on TV! First the husbands answer a question … then the wives. Do your answers match up? Guys, do you remember the outfit your wife wore on your first date? Ladies, what is your husband's favorite song? Whether you just tied the knot yesterday or thirty years ago, The Newlywed Game DVD edition is classic couples fun for everyone!

—description from the publisher

Name: Dragon Omelette
Description:
You are top chefs competing at the world wide Omelette Championships. Your goal was to make the most elite food in the world, the dragon egg omelette. This year there's a twist, the dragons want to cook you! Can you gather the most eggs and avoid the dragons to make the biggest and therefore most scrumptious omelette?

This is a press-your-luck card game, where the object is to get three or more omelettes.

—description from the publisher

Name: Maze
Description:
MAZE . . . is a game to entertain people of all ages. It is a two player game which combines strategy with chance.

The object of the game is to get all four of your playing pieces on the center dot (and off the board) before your opponent does.

Players start their men on opposite ends of the board. During the game, each player tries to get past the network of walls which his opponent is building against him. As he removes walls that are blocking him, he repositions them where he feels they will most hinder his opponent. Each tries to reach the center red dot (which is the only way off the board).

With both players heading for the center red exit dot they will often find themselves facing each other with no walls between them. These head to head encounters create exciting situations in which one or more pieces can be sent back to their respective "jail" corners to start over again.

The game is quite simple and lots of fun. The advantage can swing from one player to the other and back again many times throughout the entire game.

MAZE is [a wooden product] produced on home-made machines, silk-screened and assembled by hand. It is not a factory product, and is only offered in limited quantities.

—description from the inside of the box

Name: The Drowned Earth: Yuttaraptors
Description:
Yuttaraptors are faction neutral, and so can be used with any other factions, or as NPC models in certain scenarios or using the Alternate Rules found in the hard copy of the rulebook.

Yuttaraptors (x2), is a pack of two multi-part metal wargaming miniatures in 35mm scale. The models are lead free, and come supplied with two 40mm base and one profile card.

—description from the publisher

Name: Identity Crisis
Description:
How often do you get your family and friends confused with "Famous" or "Infamous" people? Well, when you have an Identity Crisis it happens all the time. It's a creative new game that's never the same, no-matter how many times you play.

Prepare yourself for an evening of laughter, as you and your friends enjoy the company of some very unexpected guests. You'll quickly discover that the strategy is endless and the clues are non-stop. Challenging, fun, and easy to play, Identity Crisis is a game for the whole family.

—description from the back of the box

The winner is the first person to obtain (5) "Score Cards" spelling the name "Id-en-ti-ty Crisis". It is to each person's advantage to roll "Pick a Letter" as often as possible. By doing this you are attempting to write the letters in your Identity's "abbreviated name" before another player figures out who you are. "Score Cards" are won after "Revealing" your opponent's Identity, and/or, after you "Pick" all the letters in your own Identity. Once you complete the spelling of your Identity's name - announce you have done so - replace your "Identity card" with a new one, and select one of the (5) "Score Cards". If you "Reveal" another player's Identity, you may take one of that person's "Score Cards" or one from the "Main Card Holder". If you guess wrong, your opponent may take one of your "Cards" or, one from the "Main Card Holder". Any time there is an incorrect response, the player being challenged benefits.

—description from the rulebook

Name: Priorities
Description:
The game to play with people you THINK you know--or that you WANT to know BETTER!!!!

Players must correctly predict how other players will answer their questions.

—user summary

Name: Celebrity Challenge
Description:
The Game About Famous People

CELEBRITY CHALLENGE includes individual game cards for the 60 most famous people born in each calendar month - 720 in all. Movie stars, TV celebrities, musicians, athletes, Presidents, and others . . . YOU KNOW THEM ALL!!

If you can never win at a trivia game, CELEBRITY CHALLENGE is for you. It's not just what you know, but also how you play the game. No one knows who has won until the game is over.

Best of all - everyone is included in the game at all times and each game only takes approximately 45 minutes to play.

—description from the back of the box

The object of CELEBRITY CHALLENGE is for each player to score the highest number of points by placing as many SCORING TOKENS as possible on both the 12 CELEBRITY WALK and the 12 CALENDAR SQUARES. Only one SCORING TOKEN is permitted on any of these 24 squares at any one time. The game is over when all of the 12 squares on the CELEBRITY WALK are occupied with SCORING TOKENS. A SCORING TOKEN is placed on the CELEBRITY WALK squares of the CALENDAR SQUARES by the player who first successfully identifies the name of a celebrity to whose identity clues are given by the GAME CARD READER.

Name: Depths of Courage: The Attack on New York Harbor (Volume 10)
Description:
"Depths of Courage volume 10" is a solitaire wargame on a proposed Italian mini-sub attack on New York Harbor during the summer of 1943. The active player takes on the role of the commanders of the three, two-man crew S.L.C. (Siluro a Lenta Corsa) Maiale (Pig) class and CA 2 mini-submarines. You must endeavor to overcome the US defenses and night-time visibility to inflict as much damage as possible before being killed, captured or escaping.

An Italian raid with by their frogmen was seriously planned and approved by both the Regia Marina and the Decima Mas. The planned raid was to have taken place in December 1943, but for game purposes I’ve moved it up to the summer of that year, before fascist Italy’s invasion and surrender.

A raid on the US was desirable for a number of reasons by the Italian naval high command. Potential targets in the Mediterranean were, by late 1942, well aware and experienced with the Italian raiders, and Allied defensive measures were increasingly deadly. The early 1942 German Operation Drumbeat U-Boat offensive, dubbed the “Happy Time”, exposed serious weaknesses and deficiencies in the US coastal and harbor defenses. A successful strike at the most prominent harbor in the US would be a tremendous psychological as well as military victory for the Axis cause. However, when it was proposed to their German allies in late 1941, Admiral Doenitz declined to support the operation with any U-Boats, but did approve sending any and all intelligence they came across to support Italian raid.

Unlike the frogmen raids conducted at Gibraltar, Alexandria, Algeciras and elsewhere in the Mediterranean, the raid on New York would also include the newest mini-submarine in the Italian navy’s arsenal, the CA 2. Armed with two torpedoes, these small submarines were so top secret they were never entered into the Regia Marina’s Order of Battle. Similar CA 5 type mini-submarines had raised havoc in the Black Sea and Adriatic, sinking numerous vessels and supporting blockades of enemy held ports. The CA 2 mini-sub and its crew, as well as the frogmen’s Maiale submersibles, would have to be ferried to the target area by a much larger submarine. The only one capable of doing so in the Italian navy was the fleet submarine Leonardo da Vinci. Modifications to its hull to transport the CA 2 were made in German occupied Bordeaux, and training of its crew and the raiders done in ultra-high secrecy in the Bay of Biscay. However, in May the Leonardo da Vinci was surprised and sunk by the British destroyer HMS Active and frigate HMS Ness with all hands. By that time Sicily was invaded and the Mussolini government soon over-thrown. The chaos that Italy descended to, and the new government’s later decision to cast their lot with the Allies, rendered the raid on New York to the dust bin of history.

Could the Italian navy pull off what no other nation had achieved since the War of 1812? I hope all who play Depths of Courage volume 10 learn and enjoy!

—description from the designer
Families: Series: Depths of Courage (High Flying Dice)

Name: Say What You See!
Description:
This quick-fire catchphrase guessing game asks players one thing: SAY WHAT YOU SEE! Deceptively simple, this game contains over 100 catchphrase cards and instructions. With so many pictorial rebus puzzles, the fun will go on and on! See how many popular catchphrases you can recognize.

—description from the publisher

Name: DubbleKross
Description:
DubbleKross is played in two phases: the first is the ELIMINATION PHASE where certain cards will be eliminated and their pegs placed in the PENALTY ZONE by the players rolling the dice; the second is the GAME PHASE where the remaining game pegs (representing all remaining eligible cards) are involved in a frantic race toward the WIN ZONE, also with players rolling the dice.

The objective of DubbleKross is to move one of the eligible game pegs from the "start zone" up through the "game zone" into the "win zone." Players holding the 4 cards corresponding to the winning peg collect a percentage of the pot depending upon how many of the four "win" cards each is holding. (one card gets 1/4, two cards-1/2, etc.)

—user summary

Name: Detective: City of Angels – Smoke and Mirrors
Description:
This is an all new expansion for Detective: City of Angels. Smoke and Mirrors adds the hardest cases our intrepid Detectives have had to solve so far. Do you have what it takes to see through the Smoke and Mirrors?

—description from the publisher
Families: Game: Detective – City of Angels (Van Ryder Games)

Name: TRK Hockey
Description:
TRK HOCKEY is an action-packed, fast moving, easy to play table game that will bring professional hockey action into your home!

You will be owner, general manager and coach of your own team. You set the line-ups, you make the line changes, you coach your team!

Each player's statistics from the previous system have been computed and displayed on 2" x 2 3/4" cards. His skating, shooting, passing and puck handing skills are all represented on his individual card. Even his tendency to commit penalties and his durability are represented.

Your decisions as coach will play an important roll in the outcome of each game. If you chose the right combinations your team will play up to its potential. Your ability to match up lines against your opponents lines is crucial.

TRK HOCKEY can be played both solitaire or by two or more players.

—description from the rulebook

(This is a spiral bound paperback book with perforated cards, 16 to a page.)

Name: Corporate Affairs 301
Description:
Simulate manouverings without financial responsibility. Simulate corporate politics.

The activity that teaches you to who to trust. The activity that needs no power or batteries. Keep active the mind of a 104 year old. Teach it to a 4 year old.

Corporate Affairs 301 may be played by 2 or 3 Stkrs (Stockholders). When 2 Stkrs are present, they shall manipulate Blue Company and Green Limited personnel primarily, and Red Corporation secondarily. When 3 Stkrs are present, Red Corp. personnel will be manipulated by the Red Stkr only.

Different coloured stick pins represent various company positions from Presidents to Grunts, each with different movement rules. A Stkr loses when the company loses its last Grunt.

—user summary

Name: Eyetoons
Description:
Put your musical knowledge to the test in this fun family board game. Go head to head in a variety of musical challenges. Can you identify the artist and song fromt he cartoon on the card? Can you hum the tune or draw your own 'toon'? It's a race to the finish in this action-packed musical medley.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tongue Twister
Description:
Word twisting fun to tease your tongue!

Can you say . . . "She says she shall sew a sheet"?

Now can you say it three times while patting your head and rubbing your tummy? That's the hilarious idea behind Tongue Twister.

The faster you can say a Tongue Twister, the further you move around the gameboard.

But wait a second. There's an extra "Twist". Just as you near the finish line one of your opponents can challenge you, sending you back a few spaces. But that's Tongue Twister the tongue-twisting, fast-paced, unpredictable and outrageously funny board game that will really tie an evening together!

—description from the publisher

Name: Good Impressions
Description:
Make a good impression at your next party!

Good Impressions mixes a room full of people, with a fistful of famous phrases and a mouthful of mixed up voices. The results are always sidesplitting.

Imagine imitating Richard Nixon, singing, "Tiptoe Through The Tulips", or Clint Eastwood saying, "I tot I taw a pooty tat"!

It's up to you to use voice, body language, and even props to help your team guess the name behind the impression, if they can stop laughing long enough.

Good Impressions is the ultimate party game for people who "just wanna have fun".

—description from the back of the box

Name: On the Record
Description:
This EXCITING, new game that is based on quotations is a must for all board game lovers. Enjoy many hours of fun being quizzed about quotes from the following six categories: Sports, History, Proverbs, Literature, Entertainment and General.

Because most questions offer multiple choice answers, you will find that this game will be played at a very rapid pace and with over 3,000 questions contained in this game, you may never know all the answers!

You will be entertained by quotes of W. C. Fields, be educated with excerpts from Shakespeare, be given a history lesson from the words of John F. Kennedy or just laugh at the always quotable Yogi Berra.'

—description from the publisher

Name: Risk: Assassin's Creed
Description:
Throughout history the Assassin Brotherhood and the Order of the Knights Templar have been waging a secret war. Now the Templar's grip on the free world is tightening and as a loyal Assassin, it is down to you to take back control and free humanity from their imposed world order. Play as one of five different groups of Assassins as you use your wits, strategy and a little bit of luck, to explore and free territories. Use special cards and missions in this epic Risk battle. Work in the dark to serve the light.

Key Features

     The Game of Strategic Conquest
     Choose your side, deploy your armies and go into battle
     Beautifully crafted game pieces, including Hooded Assassin and the Assassin Order Insignia.
     Quick-play version and easy set-up
     Risk is the game where you need to conquer it all


—description from the publisher
Families: Versions & Editions: Versions with IP after the original release

Name: Criminal Matters
Description:
A comprehensive trivia game of misdeeds, murder, & mystery . . . in fact & fiction.

The object of the game is to win--be putting an "X" in each box of the score card with each correct answer.

Q & A CATEGORIES: Actors & Movies, Arts & Letters, Television & Radio, Crimes & Misdemeanors.

—description from the publisher

Name: CodeMaster
Description:
Your opponent has secretly filled in his Secret Code Grid. You have done the same. You ask him questions about his Grid, while trying to reveal little about your own. Can you duplicate his Code--before he unravels yours?

It will require strategy and cunning--and a dose of logical reasoning!

Then match wits with your opponent Super-CodeMaster, using any of the eighteen Grids that come with the game. Or play it by yourself, using the Solitaire Booklet also included. Either way, it's exciting, unique and challenging.

By the makers of the puzzle, LogicMaster.

—description from the back of the box

Each player takes a Grid Sheet (a sheet of two empty 25-square grids). On the top grid each writes his secret code. This consists of the letters A through E, each written five times. Write one letter in each square. The same letter may not appear more than one In a row or in a column. Therefore every row and column will contain each of the five letters.

You must discover your opponents secret code by using sums (made from the addition of the row and column numbers containing that letter) and knowing whether the letters in two named spaces are the same or different.

—user summary

Name: Vari Trivial
Description:
Vari Trivial is a card game of both bidding and bluffing played with the trivia questions from Trivial Pursuit. It replaces the game board, die and rules.

Each player is dealt seven playing cards. These cards are numbered and color-coded to match the question categories rom Trivial Pursuit. A trivia question is read aloud and the players use the playing cards to bid for the right to answer it. The player who gives the answer is allowed to bluff, but can be challenged. A question answered incorrectly can be answered by another player. Plus and minus point cards are used to keep score. The winner is the player with the highest net score at the end of the game.

Game can be ended anytime after seven trivia questions have been answered.

—description from the back of the box

Name: Rapid Recall
Description:
No cards. No dice. No board. Just fun!

Each player picks a category, such as: Ice cream flavors, Holidays, Actos, Tropical Islands . . . Remember what they are.

Once you have that down, each person sits in front of a light and one player pushes down the yellow dome. All of the lights flash twice, until they stop at random on two players. If your light stays on, you better look for the other light, quickly! You have to name something in that players' category (Vanilla, New Years, Cary Grant or Hawaii), before they name something in yours.

See if you have Rapid Recall, and can get the words off the tip of your tongue.

—description from the publisher

Name: Crossfire
Description:
Between Checkers & Chess There's CROSSFIRE

Crossfire, 1. Lines of fire from two or more positions that cross one another; simultaneous fire along those lines. 2. An attack from two or more sources or directions

OBJECT: To collect as many points as possible while moving game pieces across board.
Points are collected by:
(A) landing on RED spots.
(B) capturing other game pieces and markers by landing on them.
(C) moving your game pieces into your opponents' home base.

—user summary

Name: Mar-Job
Description:
Welcome to the exciting game of Mar-Job!

Mar-Job is an adaptation of an ancient Oriental game that has been played and enjoyed by people world-wide for many centuries.

The exact origin of the original version is as mystical as the game itself. Chinese legend dates the original version back approximately 2,500 years!

Mar-Job challenged players' decision-making skills as they attempt to create a winning hand by drawing and discarding the unique MAR-JOB cards or 'chees'. Be careful as to which card you throw away. You might discard what another player needs to win the hand!

Mar-Job - a game of Strategy, Activity, Excitement & Fun!

—description from the publisher

Name: Eagle Eye Agency: Clue Book #2
Description:
Second series of 12 cases for Eagle Eye Agency (in alphabetical order):

A Dog Barks in Suburbia; All That Glows Is Not Gold; Black Out; Cat's Meow; Drowsy Detective; Drunken Driver; Goose Chase; He Who Laughs Last; Lights, Camera, Murder; Mirror, Mirror; Nursery Rhyme Thief; Woman With A Secret

—description from the publisher

Name: Eagle Eye Agency: Clue Book #3
Description:
Third series of 12 cases for Eagle Eye Agency. All 12 cases are numbered, but untitled. Each case is unique, although every one concerns the same theme - missing persons.

The Cases may be played in any order you wish.

—description from the publisher

Name: Tax
Description:
Tax is a 2-6 player card game using a deck containing four copies each of one through nine.


Deal five cards to each player and a sixth to the starting player. If playing with four, five or six players, deal a sixth card to the first and second players.
Place two cards face-up in the center of the table forming two separate discard piles.
On the side, place two cards face-up forming the communal card display.

Gameplay:
At the start of your turn, you must calculate the sum and the difference of the two cards atop the two discard piles.  At the end of your turn, you must be able to create one of those two values by performing one operation of addition, subtraction, multiplication or division between the two cards atop the discard piles at the end of your turn.

Taking Your Turn:
On your turn, you must make exactly one of four legal plays:

        Play a single hand card to the top of one of the discard piles.
        Play two hand cards, one to the top of each of the discard piles.
        Play one hand card to the top of a discard pile and one communal card to the top of the other discard pile.  Communal cards are not replenished when used.  A player is limited to using one communal card per turn but may use both communal cards over the course of the round.
        Fold and exit the round.  You can fold instead of performing one of the other actions.  If unable to perform one of the other actions, you must fold.
    


If the round has not ended, the next player in clockwise order who is still in the round takes his/her turn.

Round End:
If all other players have folded, the round ends immediately and the remaining player gains one point.

If a player plays his/her last card(s), the round ends immediately, and that player gains two points.

Collect the cards, shuffle, and perform the setup again.  First player rotates clockwise each round.

End condition:
The first player to reach or exceed a predetermined point value wins, for example 15 points.


Variant:
Want more information about your opponents' cards?  At the start of a round after receiving their hand of cards, all players must place a single copy of their highest and lowest cards on the table in front of them for all players to see.  These two cards are still considered to be hand cards.  Players use these two cards just like their regular hand cards and they are folded when the rest of the hand is folded.

—description from the designer

Name: 4•Plex
Description:
4•Plex is the first multi-purpose game of skill or luck. You can play for the challenge or play for fun. The varying complexity that can be created after the mastery of the Short Play are endless, yet the simplicity of play will appeal to the kid in all of us.

The sequence of play can be summarized as follows:


     Divide the board equally among the players
     Insert your color-cups into the board (setup)
     In turn, each player chooses one of the color-cups for distribution  (distribution sequence), going round and around the board until your hand ends in a previously empty cup or until it ends in a cup that forms a set (capturing sets)
     As sets of 4 plexis are formed and captured they are removed from the board and will become the property of the captor


Now that sounds simple enough! The problem is, you are not the only one trying to win. Your opponent(s) will plot against your every move. The challenge is to out-smart them and win the established advantage.

OVER 1000 LEVELS OF PLAY!

     Within the same basic playing style
     A new challenge every time you play
     No other game (video or otherwise) offers more diversity
     The ultimate in replay value (2 dimensional)
     Play 4 fun or play 4 skill
     Easy to learn (only requires the ability to count)
     Entertainment for the entire family


—description from the back of the box

Name: Quicksteel
Description:
Quicksteel is a two-player fencing card game of cunning bladework and careful timing. In Quicksteel, you take on the role of one of two fencers.  Each fencer has a deck of 65 cards.  The decks are identical and consist of the varied combat maneuvers available to you.

Like blades, the cards of Quicksteel interact in a dance of skill and timing.  The lunges, parries and infinite combinations thereof allow players to enter a world where cunning and skill win the day…not strength or size.  The basic lunges and control cards are used to score points, the parries and movement cards to prevent touches, and the Specialty cards are used in combination with the previous cards for  spectacular and powerful effects.

True to international foil fencing rules, Quicksteel gives players a tabletop equivalent to actual fencing.  The goal of every match is to be the first to score 5 points/touches (Competition mode involves 3 matches requiring a total of 15 points to win).

Quicksteel grants players a glimpse into the world of fencing, into the mind of a fencer and into one of the most ancient forms of combat – the duel.

—description from the designer

Name: TTMC: Le Complément Naturel
Description: 130 new cards for 1035 new questions

Name: Skulk Hollow: Ancient Relics Mini-Expansion
Description:
On the battlefields of Skulk Hollow, ancient relics can still be found amongst the various ruins that scatter the land. It's been said that crystalline bones of the wizards who sacrificed themselves during the creation of the Smallfolk still hold great power, even after being dormant for centuries.

—description from the publisher

Name: Dice Settlers: Sierra West Promo
Description: Promo for Dice Settlers included in Sierra West.

Name: The Everyone Shares One Butt Game
Description:
An unpredictable, competitive path-building party game where you and three other disembodied players extend your stomach to connect to the Almighty Butt. First to connect to the butt wins.

Various stomach cards and items contain effects that can sabotage other player's plans such as discarding cards, stunning players to skip turns, invading other players' bodies, and rotating or flipping the direction of the butt.

—description from the designer

Name: Cancelletto
Description:
Cancelletto (Hash) is a fast cooperative abstract game for 2 players, played on a modular board. The goal is to move all the meeples in their right cell before the board collapses.

—description from the designer

Name: Burger Battle: Battle Card Expansion Pack
Description:
Includes 10 Exclusive Battle Cards:
• 6 Standard Exclusive Cards
• 3 Joke Cards
• 1 Blank Card

-description from designer

Name: Setz drauf!
Description:
The players have to get their 5 caps from their stating line to the starting line of their opponent to win the game. Movement is in a straight line and determined by a die. If a cap gets on a black space it has to start again from the beginning.

Whenever a cap lands on an opponent cap, the later is blocked till the upper cap leaves again.

The game may be playes by 2 or 4 players.

—user summary

Name: Brainwashed: Presidential Poker
Description:
Created by Joe Stempek, Brainwashed: Presidential Poker is a highly-strategic, Presidential take on Texas Hold’em Poker. Designed, Playtested, and printed in the USA, unlike the merchandise a special “you know who” peddles...

In Brainwashed: Presidential Poker, players will take turns playing cards, manipulating cards in players hands and gaining information to position themselves to steal each other’s launch codes.  Get 7 launch codes and win the game. Find yourself without any way to launch a nuke and you’re a loser. Get out of here!

Play as one of four character’s with unique abilities to further complicate this already convoluted political process, and defeat your opponents to hold the country hostage for one more day. Get Brainwashed today!

—description from the designer

Name: Abenteuer im Weltraum: Auf dem Mond!
Description:
Auf dem Mond! is a light dice based game of lunar exploration, combined with trivia about space travel.
Game play proceeds by dice rolling: Players roll for movement points to reach the target on a moon track. Some points of the track require the answering of trivia. The player who reaches the target field first wins the game.

—user summary

Name: Highlander: moments of historie
Description:
The game takes place on a map of Scotland divided into 36 territories, of which 24 are assigned to specific clans. Each region has upper limits on the capacity of characters, livestock and crops.

The game has economic and military features. Each player starts with a single clan region and tries to gain control over additional clans by conquering more regions. The goal is to be the first to occupy a certain number of clans depending on the number of players. Conquests are made by troop movements.

To spread, players can move their pawns to neighbouring regions. Empty regions can be occupied. In occupied regions peaceful coexistence or conflicts can occur, which are then solved by figure majorities.

Conquered areas are farmed and generate income in the form of money and agricultural resource yields.
 Each clan has a knight. By participating in tournaments, which are driven by dice rolling, knights can gain weapons and shields that increase their fighting power and are thus useful in conquering, protecting and managing areas.

Gameplay is divided in 3 phases (build-up, protection and endgame) with 4 seasons each.

Name: アミーゴ！ (AMIGO!)
Description:
ã‚¢ãƒŸãƒ¼ã‚´ï¼ (AMIGO!) is a Japanese speed word game. Players must determine the start letter of a word, then call out a word that fits the chosen theme.

Each player has two thumbs up cards. After a theme card and a word card card are turned up, players choose how to play their thumb cards. A thumb up is +1, a thumb down is -1. All players reveal their thumbs (you don't have to use both) and work out the correct number of steps.
4 thumbs up and 0 thumbs down equals +4 steps on the word card, giving the start letter. 
2 thumbs up and 4 thumbs down equals -2 steps on the word card (starting at the end of the word and going backwards), giving the start letter.

If the total of thumbs is zero, everybody shouts "AMIGO!"

The first player to get a word fitting the theme and start letter gives their answer. If correct, they get the theme card. If wrong, they hand one back as a penalty.

The player with the most theme cards collected by the end is the winner.
user summary

Name: Goaly
Description:
Each player represents a soccerteam. Players try to score goals, but they have to be aware of off-side.
You can give red or yellow cards to your opponents, but the referee is still the boss on the field.

—user summary

Name: Hokus Pokus Flipibus
Description:
The big competition among the sorcerer's apprentices guarantees hectic and lots of fun. Who uses his wand most skillfully and leaves the ingredients for his potion hopping the fastest into his cauldron?

Hokus Pokus Flipibus is a dexterity game in which players have to flick tiles using a wand to make them hop off the board.

—user summary

Name: Junior Sagaland
Description:
Junior version of Sagaland / Enchanted Forest.

All together, or everyone for themselves: Junior Sagaland offers the right adventure for everyone! An exciting memory and collecting game for children ages 3 and up.

Let's go to the magical forest of Sagaland to search for the magical items of the king. Will the players be able to bring three items to the castle before the wizard arrives there? Then the Kingdom of Sagaland is saved and the game is won.

Immerse yourself in the magical world and experience its magic up close.

—user summary

Name: Kinderspiele aus aller Welt
Description:
Games are connecting people! Everywhere in our world there are exciting and funny children's games. Children play with marbles in Turkey, are clapping hands in Syria, and in Germany they knock down cans. With "Kinderspiele aus aller Welt" children not only get to know many new games from all over the world, they also take a look at other countries, experience a part of different cultures and discover many things in common.

The children look closely at pictures of a country and give a hint on which continent this country could be located. Afterwards everyone plays a mini-game together, which is played in this country. If you guess correctly, are lucky and show skill, you win!

With 24 small games from all over the world, children immerse themselves in other cultures and receive their first orientation on the world map. With vividly illustrated instructions on the playing cards, curious world explorers play independently and with lots of fun. A multitude of different game material makes the journey around the world a varied gaming experience.

—user summary

Name: Deep Dive Dice
Description:
Deep Dive Dice is a quick roll & write game for 1+ players by award winning designer Stefano Castelli (Potion Explosion, Minute Realms).

In Deep Dive Dice, players take the role of captains set to explore a sea sector trying to uncover treasures, discover underwater ruins, scan the sea floor and take pictures of sea life.

Player act all at the same time using a common set of values generated by launching three 6-sided dice and selecting actions on their personal sea sheet.

After seven game rounds the player with the most points is the winner.

Deep Dive Dice also includes simple rules for solitaire play.

The game is available in the 12th issue of the Italian boardgame magazine IoGioco, on sale in September 2019.

—description from the designer
